title: Live coverage: SpaceX attempts to launch Indonesian communications satellite following back-to-back weather scrubs
summary: The launch once again faces long odds with poor weather in the forecast for a third day in a row. SpaceX is targeting liftoff from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station at 8 p.m. EDT (0000 UTC).

title: Summary of the 11th ABoVE Science Team Meeting
summary: Introduction The NASA Arctic–Boreal Vulnerability Experiment (ABoVE) is a large-scale ecological study in the northern regions of North America (Alaska and western Canada) that was developed to understand environmental changes in the region and the implications of those changes for society. Funded primarily by the NASA Terrestrial Ecology Program, this 10-year campaign has included field, […]

title: NASA Invites Media to View Artemis Moon Rocket, Spacecraft at Kennedy
summary: Media are invited to see NASA’s fully assembled Artemis II SLS (Space Launch System) rocket and Orion spacecraft in mid-October before its crewed test flight around the Moon next year.   The event at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida will showcase hardware for the Artemis II lunar mission, which will test capabilities needed for […]

title: NASA Data, Trainings Help Uruguay Navigate Drought
summary: When Uruguay faced its worst drought in nearly a century, the nation’s water authority turned to NASA satellite data and trainings to build a reservoir-monitoring tool.

title: Boeing turns to 3D printing to speed production of satellite solar arrays
summary:
The first 3D-printed arrays will be deployed on small satellites built by Millennium Space
The post Boeing turns to 3D printing to speed production of satellite solar arrays appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: NASA Says Mars Rover Discovered Potential Biosignature Last Year
summary: A sample collected by NASA’s Perseverance Mars rover from an ancient dry riverbed in Jezero Crater could preserve evidence of ancient microbial life. Taken from a rock named “Cheyava Falls” last year, the sample, called “Sapphire Canyon,” contains potential biosignatures, according to a paper published Wednesday in the journal Nature. A potential biosignature is a […]

title: NASA Aims to Keep Fuel Cool Under Pressure with Zero Boil-Off Experiment On NG-23
summary: Space missions rely on cryogenic fluids — extremely cold liquids like liquid hydrogen and oxygen — for both propulsion and life support systems. These fuels must be kept at ultra-low cryogenic temperatures to remain in liquid form; however, solar heating and other sources of heat increase the rate of evaporation of the liquid and cause […]

title: Dinner is Served!
summary: Dinnertime fare on the International Space Station takes center stage in this Aug. 15, 2025, photo. One tray features shrimp cocktail on whole grain wheat crackers, while the other holds sushi made with seaweed, Spam, tuna, and rice. Both trays are secured with Velcro strips to keep them stable inside the Unity module’s galley. The […]

title: Rendezvous Robotics raises funding to develop technology for self-assembling space structures
summary:
A startup has raised an initial round of funding to commercialize a technology that could create large structures in orbit.
The post Rendezvous Robotics raises funding to develop technology for self-assembling space structures appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: SpaceX launches 21 satellites for Space Development Agency ‘Transport Layer’ military network
summary:
The satellites, made by York Space Systems, make up the first plane of a mesh network projected to have 126 spacecraft
